general_principles: Images should have a premium, high-quality appearance
Content must be appropriate for all audiences
Ensure elements placed on the image remain visible against the background
Composition should focus on a clear main subject
Colors should be harmonious and visually appealing
composition_guidelines: Ensure proper balance and visual weight
Consider placement of elements on the image when composing

Centered Composition: Places the main subject in the middle of the frame for balance and focus. Best practices: Ensure adequate space around the subject; Avoid cluttering the composition; Maintain symmetry where appropriate

Horizontal Line Composition: Uses parallel horizontal lines to create structure, stability, and sense of calm. Best practices: Keep horizon lines straight and properly positioned; Balance elements above and below the line; Use rule of thirds for horizon placement when appropriate

Vertical Line Composition: Uses vertical lines to create sense of height, power, and upward movement. Best practices: Ensure vertical lines are truly vertical without distortion; Use to guide eye upward through the composition; Balance with subtle horizontal elements when needed

Symmetrical Composition: Arranges visual elements in mirrored way for formal harmony and stability. Best practices: Ensure precise alignment of elements on both sides; Maintain perfect balance across central axis; Use for formal, structured visual presentations

Diagonal Composition: Arranges elements along diagonal line for energy, movement, and visual interest. Best practices: Use strong diagonal lines guiding eye through frame from corner to corner; Create clear directional flow along the diagonal; Balance with subtle opposing elements when needed

Leading Line Composition: Uses visual lines to guide viewer's eye through scene in intentional journey. Best practices: Use natural lines (roads, paths, building edges) to guide eye to key focal points; Create clear visual path through the image; Ensure lines lead to important elements rather than off-frame
Atmospheric Depth: Uses elements like soft clouds, gradients, or atmospheric haze in open spaces (skies, walls) to prevent flat, dead space while maintaining a clean aesthetic.
color_scheme_guidelines: Ensure sufficient contrast for elements placed on the image
Consider visibility of text elements on the image

Monochromatic Color Scheme: Uses variations of single color to create cohesive, sophisticated look with depth. Best practices: Use sufficient variation in lightness/darkness for visual interest; Maintain color unity while providing enough contrast; Consider using subtle neutral accents when needed

Analogous Color Scheme: Uses colors adjacent on color wheel for harmonious variation with clear relationship. Best practices: Select colors that are neighbors on the color wheel; Use one color as dominant with others as support; Limit selection to 2-3 adjacent colors for cohesiveness

Complementary Color Scheme: Uses colors opposite on color wheel to create vibrant contrast and visual energy. Best practices: Balance complementary colors carefully to avoid visual conflict; Use one as dominant and one as accent for best results; Consider using tints and shades of the complementary colors

Black and White Scheme: Uses only black, white, and grays to create timeless, classic imagery focusing on form. Best practices: Ensure sufficient contrast for visual interest; Focus on shapes, textures, and lighting; Create rich tonal range from pure black to pure white

Natural Color Scheme: Uses colors found in nature with balanced saturation and harmonious relationships. Best practices: Base palette on colors commonly found together in nature; Maintain natural color relationships and saturation levels; Create balance between warm and cool tones when appropriate

general_principles: Visual styles and technical issues that appear unprofessional
composition_errors: Poor Subject Emphasis: Main subject is insufficiently emphasized or disrupted by misaligned elements. Avoid: Avoid disruptive elements interfering with main subject; Don't create compositions with misaligned key elements; Avoid cluttered arrangements obscuring intended focal point

Incorrect Horizon Alignment: Horizon line is incorrectly placed or not level, creating disorienting effect. Avoid: Avoid tilted or slanted horizon lines; Don't position horizon line in unnatural or unbalanced position; Avoid compositions where landscape appears to be sliding off frame

Unbalanced Visual Arrangement: Asymmetrical composition creates unintentionally unbalanced visual arrangement. Avoid: Avoid unintentionally lopsided compositions that feel unstable; Don't cluster all important elements on one side without balance; Avoid awkward negative space creating unintended visual tension
color_errors: Excessive Neon Color Usage: Extremely bright, artificially saturated colors causing eye strain and UI conflicts. Avoid: Avoid neon colors that strain the eyes or create visual vibration; Don't use artificially bright, oversaturated color palettes; Avoid harsh fluorescent color schemes that appear low-quality; Steer clear of acidic, eye-straining color combinations

Low Element Contrast: Background colors that make elements (e.g., text) difficult to read. Avoid: Avoid white or very light backgrounds where text would be illegible; Don't use colors that match text element colors creating poor contrast; Avoid busy patterns in areas where text elements appear

Color Oversaturation: Excessively saturated colors that appear artificial and visually jarring. Avoid: Avoid oversaturated colors that appear artificial or enhanced; Don't push color vibrance beyond natural-looking levels; Avoid HDR-like extreme color processing

religious: Content with religious associations or symbolism. Avoid: Avoid any religious symbols, iconography, or references; Don't include any places of worship or religious architecture; Avoid depictions of religious figures, saints, or spiritual leaders; No religious attire, symbols, or practices; Avoid yoga poses that have religious associations
political: Content with political associations, figures, or symbols. Avoid: Avoid any political figures, politicians, or political themes; Don't include national flags, political symbols, or emblems; Avoid maps, country borders, or geographical divisions; No protest scenes, rallies, or political gatherings; Avoid currency, national symbols, or patriotic imagery
violence: Content depicting violence, weapons, or threatening imagery. Avoid: Avoid any weapons, guns, knives, or combat equipment; Don't include violence, aggression, or threatening scenarios; Avoid blood, injury, or physical harm; No skulls, horror elements, or frightening imagery; Avoid war scenes, destruction, or disaster imagery
health: Medical equipment, facilities, and health-related sensitive content. Avoid: Avoid any medical equipment, supplies, or instruments; Don't include hospitals, clinics, or medical facilities; Avoid face masks, PPE, or medical protective gear; No pills, medicines, injections, or medical treatments; Avoid imagery related to illness or healthcare settings
inappropriate: Revealing, suggestive, or otherwise inappropriate content. Avoid: Avoid revealing clothing or exposed skin; Don't include suggestive poses, expressions, or scenarios; Avoid intimate physical contact between individuals; No minimal clothing, shirtless individuals, or beachwear; Avoid content that could be interpreted as romantic or sensual
low_quality_styles: Visual styles and technical issues that appear unprofessional. Avoid: Avoid neon colors, harsh saturation, or eye-straining palettes; Don't use artificially bright, oversaturated color palettes; Avoid harsh fluorescent color schemes that appear low-quality; No flat vector style, cartoon illustrations, or non-photographic rendering; Avoid blurry, poorly lit, or technically flawed imagery

desired_image_attributes: **Universal Appeal:** Imagery should be culturally neutral, cosmopolitan, and relatable to a worldwide audience.
**Diversity:** When people are present, showcase a diverse mix of ethnicities and appearances to reflect a global context.
**Aesthetic:** Modern, clean, and aspirational. Use 'International Style' architecture, fashion, and settings that do not feel tied to one specific location.
**Modesty:** Clothing should be smart-casual or professional, covering shoulders and knees to ensuring acceptability across conservative and liberal cultures.
avoid_image_attributes: **Specific Cultural Markers:** Avoid text, calendars, license plates, or street signs in specific languages that ground the image in a specific country.
**Stereotypes:** Avoid relying on cultural, racial, or gender stereotypes.
**Polarizing Themes:** Avoid content that implies specific political or religious affiliations.
**Seasonality:** Avoid specific seasonal markers (e.g., snow, autumn leaves) unless relevant to the topic, to maintain global relevance.
prohibited_content: **Alcohol:** Alcoholic beverages, wine glasses, bars, or cocktail imagery (to ensure safety for Middle Eastern/Asian markets).
**Religion & Politics:** Religious symbols, houses of worship, political flags, or figures.
**Revealing Clothing:** Sleeveless tops, deep necklines, miniskirts, or swimwear (unless in a specific swimming context).
**Violence & Weapons:** Firearms, knives, or aggressive conflict.
**Controversial Food:** Pork products or raw meat (to ensure broad dietary acceptability).

allowed_content: Destination Types: Famous museums, galleries, theaters, concert halls, opera houses, non-religious cultural landmarks, and iconic architectural sites.
Presentation: High-quality, professional photography aesthetic, well-composed with proper architectural alignment, vibrant yet natural colors, and good lighting.
Composition: Clear main subject without obstructions, balanced framing, straight vertical and horizontal lines, and an uncluttered, serene feel.
prohibited_content: Destination Types: Religious buildings (temples, churches, etc.), controversial or political art installations, celebrity homes, or backstage/private areas.
Scenarios: Crowded festivals or concerts, paparazzi-style imagery, nightlife scenes, or events with alcohol consumption.
Visual Elements: Recognizable copyrighted artwork within the scene, unflattering angles, poor lighting, distracting foreground elements, or heavily filtered/edited images.
generation_directives: Generate a premium, sophisticated, and serene image of the specified cultural landmark, museum, or venue.
Position the main subject to occupy the lower three-quarters of the frame, leaving the top quarter of the image open and uncluttered.
The composition must be clean, with a clear and unobstructed view of the primary subject.
Ensure all architectural lines are straight and not distorted.
The scene must be free of crowds, tourists, or other distracting people.
Use professional, gallery-style diffused lighting or beautiful, balanced natural light.
Avoid showing any specific, recognizable, or copyrighted pieces of art inside museums or galleries.
Do not include religious symbols, political themes, or controversial content.
Ensure the location appears clean, well-maintained, and aspirational.

allowed_content: Presentation: Premium, sleek, and aspirational with professional, dynamic lighting that highlights vehicle design and form.
Subjects: Generic and unbranded modern vehicles, including sedans, SUVs, electric cars (EVs), and futuristic concept designs.
Settings: Scenic open roads, modern architectural environments, minimalist studio settings, clean cityscapes, and futuristic landscapes.
Concepts: Abstract representations of innovation, performance, sustainability, and advanced automotive design.
prohibited_content: Branding: Recognizable brand logos, badges, emblems, or specific, trademarked vehicle models and design elements (e.g., unique grilles or headlight shapes).
Scenarios: Accidents, vehicle damage, unsafe or reckless driving, street racing, traffic jams, cluttered repair shops, or used car lots.
Visuals: Visible license plates, dirt, dents, scratches, political or offensive bumper stickers, or low-quality/amateurish vehicle modifications.
People: Visible drivers or passengers, to maintain focus strictly on the vehicle's design and concept.

Creative & Thematic Goals: Generate a premium, high-end image of a **sleek, unbranded concept vehicle** that is **flawlessly clean and dynamically lit**, using professional studio or dramatic natural light to **accentuate its design lines and curves**.
The **vehicle** must be the clear hero, looking aspirational, modern, and innovative.
The scene should be elegant and uncluttered, using a compelling background to enhance the vehicle's aesthetic without causing distractions.
Compositional & UI Guidelines: Compositional Rule: The main subject **(the vehicle)** must be positioned to occupy the lower three-quarters of the frame, leaving the top quarter of the image open and uncluttered.
Compositional Rule: The primary subject must be perfectly centered or balanced within the composition, **presented in its entirety and fully visible without being cropped on any side**.
Compositional Rule: The entire subject must be fully visible, with a clear margin of space between its lowest point and the bottom edge of the frame.
The final output must be a full-bleed 9:16 portrait. The image content must extend to all four edges of the frame with no borders, bars, or letterboxing.

allowed_content: Presentation: Serene, calming, and positive, with a clean and natural aesthetic that promotes well-being and balance.
Subjects: Individuals engaged in yoga, meditation, or light exercise (stretching, walking). Abstract concepts of mental clarity and mindfulness.

**Wellness Equipment:** A curated selection of premium, sculptural tools that double as aesthetic objects: **High-quality yoga mats (textured natural rubber, jute, or cork), high-density textured foam rollers (matte black or deep grey only), aesthetic kettlebells (matte vinyl or neoprene coated in earth tones), minimalist vertical dumbbell stands (organizing small weights neatly), wooden balance boards, linen or cotton meditation bolsters.**
Settings: Tranquil natural landscapes (beaches, forests, mountains at sunrise), minimalist yoga studios, pilates studios, home exercise corners, clean and bright wellness spaces.
Concepts: Abstract representations of balance, mental health, tranquility, and a healthy lifestyle. Focus on holistic well-being rather than intense fitness.
prohibited_content: Medical Content: Hospitals, clinics, surgery, doctors, patients, medication, pills, supplements, or any depiction of illness or injury.

**Heavy Fitness Content:** Industrial gym machinery (large cable machines, leg presses, squat racks), rusty or heavy iron plates, bodybuilding imagery, extreme sweating, or 'gritty' garage gym atmospheres.
Extreme Transformations: 'Before and after' images, tape measures around body parts, or unrealistic body standards.
Branding: Gym logos, fitness apparel brands, supplement branding, or specific wellness product placements.
Visuals: Revealing or overly tight athletic wear, suggestive poses, visible sweat, exhaustion, or pain.
**Clich Zen Symbols: Zen stones, stacking rocks, pebbles, river stones, worry stones, balancing rocks, sand gardens, abstract spirals.**

Creative & Thematic Goals: **Role:** Act as a High-End Lifestyle Photographer (styled like Kinfolk, Cereal Magazine, or Architectural Digest). Your priority is **'Quiet Luxury'** and **'Tactile Realism'** over generic commercial brightness.

**Lighting Philosophy:** Focus on 'Atmospheric Softness'. Use 'Diffused Morning Glow', 'Dappled Sunlight (Komorebi)', or 'Warm Off-Camera Side Light' to reveal textures. The light should feel restorative and warm, never harsh or clinical.

**Color Strategy:** AVOID 'Clinical Sterility' (all white). Use a palette of **'Warm Earth Tones'** (sage, terracotta, sand, warm beige, soft timber). If the subject is light/white, the background MUST provide tonal contrast (e.g., natural wood, textured stone, or a soft shadow play).

**Materiality & Physics:** Enforce 'Controlled Imperfection'. Objects must obey gravity (fabrics must drape and fold naturally, mats should unroll with slight organic curves). Surfaces must be tactile (raw wood grain, woven linen, porous stone, condensation on glass) to prevent the 'plastic 3D render' look.
Compositional & UI Guidelines: Compositional Rule: The main subject must be positioned strictly within the vertical middle of the frame (2nd and 3rd quarters), leaving both the top and bottom quarters completely open and uncluttered.
Compositional Rule: The primary subject must be perfectly centered and symmetrically composed, **presented in its entirety and fully visible without being cropped on any side**.
Compositional Rule: The entire subject must be fully visible, with a clear margin of space between its lowest point and the bottom edge of the frame.
The final output must be a full-bleed 9:16 portrait. The image content must extend to all four edges of the frame with no borders, bars, or letterboxing.
